title: Facebook Kicked Out of Socially Responsible Index Over Privacy Practices
text: S&P Dow Jones doesn't seem to think the social networking giant is good for the world.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook has big companies backing its upcoming cryptocurrency
text: Facebook Inc. has signed up more than a dozen companies including Visa Inc. V, -1.31%  , Mastercard Inc.

title: Uber, payments firms reportedly sign on to back Facebook's blockchain project
text: Uber, PayPal, Visa and Mastercard have reportedly signed up to support Facebook's upcoming blockchain project.

title: Instagram is down across the web
text: An outage has hit Instagram.

title: Facebook, YouTube, Twitter must team up to fight threat from deepfakes, experts say
text: Deepfake specialists tell Congress that for society and democracy to weather the storm of manipulated media, social-media competitors must work together.

title: Facebook's banned research app collected data on almost 200K users
text: The app paid users, including teens, up to $20 a month for data on how they used their phones.

title: Facebook gets dumped from an S&P index that tracks socially responsible companies
text: S&P Dow Jones Indices announced Thursday that the social network no longer will be part of the S&P 500 ESG Index.

title: Facebook Buys Stake In India's Meesho
text: Facebook Inc. is buying a stake in the Indian social commerce start-up Meesho, according to Reuters.

title: Legal Expert Breaks Down Antitrust Risk For Big US Tech Stocks
text: One of the biggest uncertainties for U.S. tech stock investors these days is the growing uncertainty surrounding potential antitrust action.

title: Zuckerberg values profits over privacy: Tech expert
text: Disruptive Tech Research founder Lou Basenese on Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg knowing of privacy issues on the platform.

title: Antitrust expert Doug Melamed on the new probes into Big Tech
text: Doug Melamed, Stanford law professor, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss how the Microsoft antitrust case he helped bring to court might affect the new probes into major tech companies.

title: Facebook under fire from another privacy controversy
text: Stephanie Mehta, editor-in-chief of Fast Company, and Kevin Delaney, editor-in-chief of Quartz, discuss Facebook's latest privacy controversy and whether the CEO Mark Zuckerberg is serious about privacy.

title: Facebook's banned research app collected data on almost 200K users, report says     - CNET
text: The app paid users, including teens, $20 to give Facebook access to how they use their phones.

title: This overlooked Facebook business could be worth $5 billion a year, Deutsche Bank says
text: Facebook Watch has been conspicuously overlooked since it made its debut in 2017.

title: This underrated Facebook business is 'an emerging part' of the bull case, says Deutsche Bank
text: Facebook Inc.'s [s; fb] Facebook Watch video product hasn't received much love from investors since it launched two summers ago, but Deutsche Bank's Lloyd Walmsley sees room for the offering to become a $5 billion annual business "in the next few years.

title: Social Media: Two experts break down the top media story of the week
text: Tom Rogers, Winview Executive Chairman and former CEO of TiVo, and Ed Lee, New York Times media reporter, join "Squawk Box" to discuss the latest details of social media controversies.

title: Here's what social media regulation might look like
text: Questions circle whether Facebook will have to pay for hosting inappropriate content.

title: Lawmakers consider regulating the news shared on Facebook
text: Questions circle whether Facebook will have to regulate the news content shared on the site.

title: Facebook backs social commerce startup Meesho in first India investment
text: As Facebook explores ways to generate revenue from WhatsApp, the company is now turning to a startup that already has a lead. The social juggernaut said today it has invested in social-commerce startup Meesho in what is the first time the firm takes equity in an Indian startup.

title: Facebook, Twitter and YouTube grapple with altered videos ahead of 2020 election     - CNET
text: Doctored Pelosi video might be the tip of the iceberg.

title: Irish data watchdog: Some Facebook probes to conclude in coming months
text: Helen Dixon, Ireland's data protection commissioner, says she has met with senior executives at the social media giant.

title: Why Microsoft’s Old Antitrust Case Is a Bad Omen for Google and Facebook
text: New Big Tech antitrust probes recall memories of Microsoft and others whose valuations suffered after the commencing of antitrust lawsuits.

title: Facebook's EU regulator says it 'remains to be seen' if Mark Zuckerberg is serious about privacy
text: Ireland's Data Protection Commission will conclude some of its investigations into Facebook in "coming months," its boss told CNBC.
